com.esri.mo2.xml.prj
Class LayoutProject

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.xml.prj.LayoutProject
All Implemented Interfaces:
Project
public final class LayoutProject
extends Object
implements Project

This class contains functionality to handle loading/saving of an Extended ArcXML configuration file (default file extension is "*.axl").

Here is an example of using the class to load the file:
     //precondition: String absolutePath, com.esri.mo2.map.core.Layout layout;
     //precondition: import com.esri.mo2.xml.prj.UserCredentialHandler chandler;
      LayoutProject extendedProject = new LayoutProject(absolutePath);
      extendedProject.setRegisteredEnvironment(new Environment());
      extendedProject.setRegisteredLayout(layout);
      extendedProject.load(chandler);

Here is an example of using the class to save the file:
      //precondition: String absolutePath, com.esri.mo2.core.Layout layout;
      LayoutProject extendedProject = new LayoutProject(absolutePath);
      extendedProject.setRegisteredEnvironment(new Environment());
      extendedProject.setRegisteredLayout(layout);
      extendedProject.save();

This class might ( and should in most cases!) be used to de/serialize a map object from/into a configuration file. A user can use saveMapProject and loadMapProject static helper methods from com.esri.mo2.ui.xml.ClientProjectHelper class for this purpose. Here is an example of using loadMapProject static helper method to populate a map:
     //precondition: String absolutePath, com.esri.mo2.map.core.Map map;
      LayoutProject extendedProject = ClientProjectHelper.loadMapProject(absolutePath, map);

Here is an example of using saveMapProject static helper method to create a configuration file based on a map content:
     //precondition: String absolutePath, com.esri.mo2.map.core.Map map;
      LayoutProject extendedProject = ClientProjectHelper.saveMapProject(absolutePath, map);
In this case the configuration file will be saved using the Extended ArcxML and a new layout project that contains a signle map element wrapping the map will be returned.

getActiveMapElement

public MapElement getActiveMapElement()
obtains the active map element of the layout project. The active map element is one of the map elements of a layout currently registered with the layout project.

Returns:
the active map element of the layout project or null, if there is no such a map element

setActiveMapElement

public void setActiveMapElement(MapElement mapElt)
sets a map element as the active map element for the layout project.

Parameters:
mapElt - a map element from the registered layout currently associated with the layout project.
